controllerServices.name: Qualys Report Type to Table Name Lookup

labels.label: This creates a zip file in the archive directory containing all the downloaded and ETL'd data.

processors.name: Manually Archive Data in Staging Area
Set the ZIP Filename to Archive
Save the ZIP Archive to HDFS

labels.label: Generate PCAR DIff Report PCAR-PAIR and PCAR-RR5

entry.value: select ip, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',dns)) as dns, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',netbios)) as netbios, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',os)) as os, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',tracking)) as tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, reason, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, count(distinct what) as tbls, case when sum(inPAIRauth)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inPAIRauth, case when sum(inPCauth)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inPCauth, case when sum(inVMtag)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inVMtag, case when sum(inRR5)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inRR5 from ( select 'Auth Data' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 1 as inPCauth, 0 as inPAIRauth, 0 as inVMtag, 0 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' and segment<>'PAIR DB' -- and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') union select 'PAIR Data' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 0 as inPCauth, 1 as inPAIRauth, 0 as inVMtag, 0 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' and segment='PAIR DB' -- and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') union select 'IP Data' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 0 as inPCauth, 0 as inPAIRauth, 1 as inVMtag, 0 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' -- and segment='PAIR DB' -- and technology not in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') -- and technology in ('Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall', 'Windows', 'Not Attempted') and ip in ( select ip from final_hosttags as ht join final_hosts as ho on (ht.hostkey=ho.hostkey) join final_tags as tags on (tags.tagkey=ht.tagkey) where ht.report_date=current_date and lower(title) like '%pair%' group by ip order by ip ) union select 'PAIR Policy' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 0 as inPCauth, 0 as inPAIRauth, 0 as inVMtag, 1 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' -- and segment='PAIR DB' -- and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') -- and technology in ('Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall', 'Windows', 'Not Attempted') and ip in ( select ip as i from pc_results as pr join pc_summary as ps on (pr.reportkey=ps.reportkey) where pr.report_date=current_date and instance not like 'Patter%' and ps.name like '%RR5%' group by ip ) order by ip ) as q1 where technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') -- or technology in ('Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall', 'Windows', 'Not Attempted') group by ip, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, reason, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port order by ip, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, reason, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port

select pa.name, ip, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, status, case when technology like 'MySQL' and reason like 'MySQL%database%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*\\s*\\s+database\\s+([^\\s,]+).*$', '$1') when technology like 'Oracle' and reason like '%on SID %' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*\\s*on\\s+SID\\s+([^\\s]+).*$', '$1') when technology like 'MSSQL' and reason like '%database%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*,\\s*database\\s*([^,]+).*$', '$1') when reason like 'DB2%DB%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*DB\\s*=\\s*([^,]+).*$', '$1') else '' end as dbname, case when technology like 'Oracle' and reason like '%Service Name %' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*\\s*Service Name\\s+([^\\s,]+).*$', '$1') when technology like 'MSSQL' and reason like '%instance%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*instance\\s*([^,]+).*$', '$1') else '' end as dbinstance, case when technology like 'MySQL' and reason like 'MySQL%for user%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*\\s*\\s+user\\s+\'([^\']+)\'@\'([^\']+).*$', '$1@$2') when technology like 'Oracle' and reason like '%for user%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*\\s*for user\\s+([^\\s]+).*$', '$1') when technology like 'MSSQL' and reason like '%user%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*user:\\s*([^,]+).*$', '$1') when reason like 'DB2%user%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*user\\s*=\\s*([^,]+).*$', '$1') else '' end as dbuser, case when technology like 'MySQL' and reason like 'MySQL%port%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*\\s*\\s+port\\s+([\\d]+).*$', '$1') when technology like 'Oracle' and reason like '%port%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*,\\s*port\\s+([\\d.]+).*$', '$1') when technology like 'MSSQL' and reason like '%port%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*port\\s*([\\d.]+).*$', '$1') when reason like 'DB2%port%' then regexp_replace(reason, '^.*port\\s+(\\d+).*$', '$1') else '' end as dbport, reason, current_date as report_date from ( select report, technology, hosttechnology, instance, ip, dns, netbios, tracking, status, reason, count(distinct ag) as ags, report_date from raw_pc_authresults group by report, technology, hosttechnology, instance, ip, dns, netbios, tracking, status, reason, report_date ) as pr -- report -- from raw_pc_authresults as pr join raw_pc_authsummary as pa on (pr.report_date=pa.report_date and pr.report=pa.report) -- join (select name, max(report_date) as report_date from raw_pc_authsummary where datediff(current_date, report_date)<7 group by name) as m1 on (pa.name=m1.name and pa.report_date=m1.report_date) where status not like 'Passed' and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'Oracle', 'MongoDB') and pr.report_date in (select max(report_date) from raw_pc_authsummary where name like 'PCAR-PAIR%') and name like 'PCAR-PAIR%' -- and pr.report in (select name, max(report_date) from raw_pc_authsummary where datediff(current_date, report_date)<7 group by name) -- and (technology not like 'Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall' and technology not like 'Windows') -- these are os auths -- and reason not like '%MS SQL auto-discovery failed%' -- and reason not like 'Insufficient privileges' -- and reason not like 'There are no records set up for the host type.' -- and ip like '10.101.185.23'

select ip, dns, netbios, os, port, vm.qid, vm.type, vm.severity, status, title from final_hosts fh join final_vm as vm on (fh.hostkey=vm.hostkey) join final_kb as kb on (vm.qidkey=kb.qidkey) where fh.report_date=current_date and lower(title) like '%weblogic%' order by ip, dns, netbios, os, vm.type, vm.severity, status, port, vm.qid

select ip, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',dns)) as dns, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',netbios)) as netbios, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',os)) as os, collect_set(distinct concat_ws(',',tracking)) as tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, reason, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, count(distinct what) as tbls, case when sum(inPAIRauth)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inPAIRauth, case when sum(inPCauth)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inPCauth, case when sum(inVMtag)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inVMtag, case when sum(inRR5)>=1 then 1 else 0 end as inRR5 from ( select 'Auth Data' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 1 as inPCauth, 0 as inPAIRauth, 0 as inVMtag, 0 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' and segment<>'PAIR DB' -- and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') union select 'PAIR Data' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 0 as inPCauth, 1 as inPAIRauth, 0 as inVMtag, 0 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' and segment='PAIR DB' -- and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') union select 'IP Data' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 0 as inPCauth, 0 as inPAIRauth, 1 as inVMtag, 0 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' -- and segment='PAIR DB' -- and technology not in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') -- and technology in ('Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall', 'Windows', 'Not Attempted') and ip in ( select ip from final_hosttags as ht join final_hosts as ho on (ht.hostkey=ho.hostkey) join final_tags as tags on (tags.tagkey=ht.tagkey) where ht.report_date=current_date and lower(title) like '%pair%' group by ip order by ip ) union select 'PAIR Policy' as what, ip, dns, netbios, os, tracking, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, 0 as inPCauth, 0 as inPAIRauth, 0 as inVMtag, 1 as inRR5 from pc_auth where report_date=current_date -- and status<>'Passed' -- and segment='PAIR DB' -- and technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') -- and technology in ('Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall', 'Windows', 'Not Attempted') and ip in ( select ip as i from pc_results as pr join pc_summary as ps on (pr.reportkey=ps.reportkey) where pr.report_date=current_date and instance not like 'Patter%' and ps.name like '%RR5%' group by ip ) order by ip ) as q1 -- where technology in ('IBM DB2', 'MSSQL', 'MySQL', 'MongoDB', 'Oracle') -- or technology in ('Unix/Cisco/Checkpoint Firewall', 'Windows', 'Not Attempted') group by ip, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, reason, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port order by ip, technology, hosttechnology, instance, status, reason, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, `domain`, port

-- ADD TRACKING
select ip, dns, netbios, technology, instance, count(*) as records, count(tbl) as tbls from ( select 'pcr' as tbl, ip, dns, netbios, technology, instance from tmp_nbb_pcr as pcr union select 'pca' as tbl, ip, dns, netbios, technology, instance from tmp_nbb_pcr as pca ) as q1 group by ip, dns, netbios, technology, instance order by ip, dns, netbios, technology, instance

-- generate all failiure database select collect_set(reportkey) as reportkeys, report, name, segment, policy, ags, ip, dns, netbios, tracking, os, technology, hosttechnology, status, instance, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, domain, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, report_date from pc_auth where report_date=current_date and status<>'Passed' group by report, name, segment, policy, ags, ip, dns, netbios, tracking, os, technology, hosttechnology, status, instance, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, domain, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, report_date order by report, name, segment, policy, ags, ip, dns, netbios, tracking, os, technology, hosttechnology, status, instance, dbname, dbinstance, `user`, domain, port, reason, lastauth, lastsuccess, report_date

select ip, -- dbname, count(distinct ds) as dss, sum(case when ds='pcar' then 1 else 0 end) as inpcar, sum(case when ds='pcar' and passed>0 then 1 else 0 end) as pcarpassed, sum(case when ds='pcar' and failed>0 then 1 else 0 end) as pcarfailed, sum(case when ds='rr5' then 1 else 0 end) as inrr5 , sum(case when ds='rr5' and passed>0 then 1 else 0 end) as rr5passed, sum(case when ds='rr5' and failed>0 then 1 else 0 end) as rr5failed, count(*) as totalrecords, sum(case when passed>0 then 1 else 0 end) as totalpassed, sum(case when failed>0 then 1 else 0 end) as totalfailed from ( select 'pcar' as ds, ip, dbport, dbname, dbinstance, count(*) cnt, sum(case when status = 'Passed' then 1 else 0 end) as passed, sum(case when status <> 'Passed' then 1 else 0 end) as failed from tmp_db_pcar group by ip, dbport, dbname, dbinstance union select 'rr5' as ds, ip, dbport, dbname, dbinstance, count(*) as cnt, sum(case when status = 'Passed' then 1 else 0 end) as passed, sum(case when status <> 'Passed' then 1 else 0 end) as failed from tmp_db_rr5 group by ip, dbport, dbname, dbinstance ) as q group by ip --, dbname order by ip --, dbname
PCAR Report - DB - IP Diff Report
PCAR Report - DB - IP Diff Report

select vm.qid, vm.type, vm.severity, patchable, rp.released, kb.title, count(*) as records from final_vm as vm left join ref_patch as rp on (rp.qidkey=vm.qidkey) join final_kb as kb on (vm.qidkey=kb.qidkey) join final_sl as sl on (vm.qidkey=sl.qidkey) where vm.report_date=current_date and patchable=1 and vm.type='Confirmed' and vm.severity in (4,5) -- and released is null and sl.title = 'All Missing Patches - Confirmed Sev 4-5 Vuls Only' and sl.title not in ( 'GIRM - EOL Issues - Dynamic', 'GIRM - EOL Issues - Static', 'GIRM - Missing Service Packs', 'GIRM - Missing Service Packs - Static' ) group by vm.qid, vm.type, vm.severity, patchable, rp.released, kb.title

select hosts.hostkey, collect_set(hosts.id) as ids, collect_set(hosts.ip) as ips, collect_set(hosts.dns) as dns, collect_set(hosts.netbios) as netbios, -- collect_set(hosts.os) as os, collect_set(vm.qid) as qid, -- collect_set(vm.status) as status, -- collect_set(vm.severity) as severity, -- collect_set(vm.type) as type, -- collect_set(kb.title) as title, -- collect_set(hosts.qghostid) as qghostid, -- collect_set(vm.results) as results, collect_set(vm.port) as ports, collect_set( distinct case when vm.qid in (19307,19145,90087) then 'MSSQL' when vm.qid in (19087,105485,19844,105486,19000,19845) then 'MSSQL' when vm.qid in (105421,19648,105420,19545,19207) then 'DB2' when vm.qid in (105193,19129,105299,19226,105329,19233,105330,19014,45044,19225) then 'Oracle' when vm.qid in (105708,20032,105709,45167,20033) then 'Mongo' else null end ) as technologies from final_vm as vm join final_hosts as hosts on (vm.hostkey=hosts.hostkey) join final_kb as kb on (vm.qidkey=kb.qidkey) where vm.report_date=current_date and hosts.report_date=current_date and kb.report_date=current_date -- and hosts.hostkey='20200311100008303' and vm.qid in (105193,19129,105299,19226,105329,19233,105330,19014,45044,19225,19207,19545,19648,105420,105421,19307,19145,90087,19087,19000,19844,19845,105485,105486,45167,20032,20033,105708,105709) group by hosts.hostkey order by hosts.hostkey

select ip, dns, netbios, tracking, technology, instance, status, records, regexp_replace(instance, '^([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):*([^:]*)$', '$1') as dbtype, regexp_replace(instance, '^([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):*([^:]*)$', '$3') as dbport, regexp_replace(instance, '^([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):*([^:]*)$', '$4') as dbname, regexp_replace(instance, '^([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):([^:]+):*([^:]*)$', '$5') as dbinstance from ( select pr.ip, pr.dns, pr.netbios, pr.tracking, pr.technology, pr.instance, pr.status, pr.evidence, count(*) as records, current_date as report_date from pc_results as pr join pc_summary as ps on (pr.reportkey=ps.reportkey) where pr.report_date in (select max(report_date) from pc_summary where name like 'PAIR-RR5-%') and name like 'PAIR-RR5-%' and status not like 'Passed' group by pr.ip, pr.dns, pr.netbios, pr.tracking, pr.technology, pr.instance, pr.status, pr.evidence ) as q1

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.value:
# Qualys Policy Compliance Report Tag Section Parser # # [20200320-nbb] initial implementation # [20200408-nbb] handled use case of no tags (and stupid duplicate ip at that..) import json import java.io import re from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback # this callback is used for the main report parsing class PyStreamCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self, flowfile, ctx): self.ff = flowfile self.ctx = ctx pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.readLines(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) reports = self.ctx.getProperty("report.types").getValue() for line in text: ip = re.match(r'^"([^"]+)",.+$', line) tags = re.match(r'^"[^"]+",(.+)$', line) if tags is None: continue tags = re.sub(r'"', "", tags.group(1)) outputStream.write('"' + ip.group(1) + '","' + tags + "\"\n") ##content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\']', "\\'", content) # escape out all single quotes #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\"]{2}', '\\"', content) # Hive escape out all SQL escaped quotes #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\\][\"]([\n\r])+', '
', content) # escape out all escaped quotes #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[^\"]([\n\r]+)', '
', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks #content = re.sub(r'(?m)([\\][^\"\\]*)', r'\\\1', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks #outputStream.write(line + "\n") # main starting point - gets the flowfile and proceeds to read and parse flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile,PyStreamCallback(flowFile, context)) #flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", flowFile.getAttribute('filename').split('.')[0]) #flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'report', "HEADER") session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)

select sum(cnt) as cnt from (select count(distinct report) as cnt from raw_pc_summary where datediff(current_date,report_date)<=7 and report = '${qg.id}' union select count(distinct report) as cnt from raw_pc_authsummary where report = '${qg.id}') as q

# Qualys Policy Compliance Report CSV Parser # # - Splits nested sections from a Qualys PC CSV Report # - Generates a new flowfile for each sections # - Report name is saved to ${report} for each section # - Regex is a processor property named ${report.types} # # [20200123-nbb] initial implementation # [20200124-nbb] adjusted to resolve embedded newlines in evidence # [20200124-nbb] adjusted to handle another Qualysism "'-", which confuses Hive # [20200127-nbb] escape single-quotes (') as it's throwing Hive off.. # [20200206-nbb] handled subreport preheader line(s) and header # [20200211-nbb] too much to list # [20200212-nbb] escape \ from usernames (eg. MFCGD\username) import json import java.io import re from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback # this callback is used for IO for the nested CSV flowfiles class reportCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self, content): self.content = content pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): outputStream.write(self.content) # this callback is used for the main report parsing class PyStreamCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self, flowfile, ctx): self.ff = flowfile self.ctx = ctx pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.readLines(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) reports = self.ctx.getProperty("report.types").getValue() #prepend = self.ctx.getProperty("prepend").getValue() pattern = re.compile(reports) report = None zS = -1 zE = -1 subhead = None for line in text: m = pattern.match(line) zE += 1 # skip until quoted line if (subhead == None and line[0] != '"'): zS += 1 next else: subhead = zS # this is the header if report == None and m == None: outputStream.write(line + "\n") next # these are intermediate reports prior to the results if report != None and m != None: if re.match(r'^["]', line[0]) != None: zS += 1 self.processReport(report, "\n".join(text[zS:zE])) #log.info("Report End - " + str(zE-zS) + " line(s)") # pass along to the next if to reinitialize if m != None: report = m.group(1) subhead = None zS = zE + 1 #log.info("Report Start - " + report) next # This is the big report containing the results if report != None: if re.match(r'^["]', line[0]) != None: zS += 1 #self.processReport(report, "\n".join(text[zS:])) content = "\n".join(text[zS:]) text = "" # get this out of memory as soon as possible(java heap w/ Jython) self.processReport(report, content) #log.info("Process completed..") # this method initializes a new flowfile and adds the report as content def processReport(self, report, content): if len(content) <= 0: return None #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\']', "\\'", content) # escape out all single quotes content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\"]{2}', '\\"', content) # Hive escape out all SQL escaped quotes content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\\][\"]([\n\r])+', '
', content) # escape out all escaped quotes content = re.sub(r'(?m)[^\"]([\n\r]+)', '
', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks content = re.sub(r'(?m)([\\][^\"\\]*)', r'\\\1', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks #log.info("Report - " + report + " is " + str(len(content)) + " byte(s)") newff = session.create(self.ff) newff = session.putAttribute(newff, 'report', report) newff = session.write(newff, reportCallback(content)) session.transfer(newff, REL_SUCCESS) # main starting point - gets the flowfile and proceeds to read and parse flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile,PyStreamCallback(flowFile, context)) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", flowFile.getAttribute('filename').split('.')[0]) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'report', "HEADER") session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)

processors.name: Lookup Report Type to Table Name

entry.value:
# Qualys Policy Compliance Report CSV Parser # # - Splits nested sections from a Qualys PC CSV Report # - Generates a new flowfile for each sections # - Report name is saved to ${report} for each section # - Regex is a processor property named ${report.types} # # [20200123-nbb] initial implementation # [20200124-nbb] adjusted to resolve embedded newlines in evidence # [20200124-nbb] adjusted to handle another Qualysism "'-", which confuses Hive # [20200127-nbb] escape single-quotes (') as it's throwing Hive off.. # [20200206-nbb] handled subreport preheader line(s) and header # [20200211-nbb] too much to list # [20200212-nbb] escape \ from usernames (eg. MFCGD\username) # [20200407-nbb] adjusting substitutions import json import java.io import re from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback # this callback is used for IO for the nested CSV flowfiles class reportCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self, content): self.content = content pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): outputStream.write(self.content) # this callback is used for the main report parsing class PyStreamCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self, flowfile, ctx): self.ff = flowfile self.ctx = ctx pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.readLines(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) reports = self.ctx.getProperty("report.types").getValue() #prepend = self.ctx.getProperty("prepend").getValue() pattern = re.compile(reports) report = None zS = -1 zE = -1 subhead = None for line in text: m = pattern.match(line) zE += 1 # skip until quoted line if (subhead == None and line[0] != '"'): zS += 1 next else: subhead = zS # this is the header if report == None and m == None: outputStream.write(line + "\n") next # these are intermediate reports prior to the results if report != None and m != None: if re.match(r'^["]', line[0]) != None: zS += 1 self.processReport(report, "\n".join(text[zS:zE])) #log.info("Report End - " + str(zE-zS) + " line(s)") # pass along to the next if to reinitialize if m != None: report = m.group(1) subhead = None zS = zE + 1 #log.info("Report Start - " + report) next # This is the big report containing the results if report != None: if re.match(r'^["]', line[0]) != None: zS += 1 #self.processReport(report, "\n".join(text[zS:])) content = "\n".join(text[zS:]) text = "" # get this out of memory as soon as possible(java heap w/ Jython) self.processReport(report, content) #log.info("Process completed..") # this method initializes a new flowfile and adds the report as content def processReport(self, report, content): if len(content) <= 0: return None #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\']', "\\'", content) # escape out all single quotes content = re.sub(r'(?m)("")', "'", content) # Hive escape out all SQL escaped quotes content = re.sub(r'(?m)([\\,][\"][\n\r]+)', r'\\"
', content) # escape out all escaped quotes content = re.sub(r'(?m)([^\"])([\n\r]+)', r'\1
', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks content = re.sub(r'(?m)([\\][^\"\\]*)', r'\\\1', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks #log.info("Report - " + report + " is " + str(len(content)) + " byte(s)") newff = session.create(self.ff) newff = session.putAttribute(newff, 'report', report) newff = session.write(newff, reportCallback(content)) session.transfer(newff, REL_SUCCESS) # main starting point - gets the flowfile and proceeds to read and parse flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile,PyStreamCallback(flowFile, context)) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", flowFile.getAttribute('filename').split('.')[0]) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'report', "HEADER") session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)

entry.value: select count(*) as cnt from raw_pc_reports as pcr left join raw_pc_summary as pcs on (pcr.report=pcs.report) left join raw_pc_authsummary as pcas on (pcr.report=pcas.report) where datediff(current_date,pcr.report_date)<7 and (pcs.report is null and pcas.report is null)

# Qualys Policy Compliance Report Tag Section Parser # # [20200320-nbb] initial implementation import json import java.io import re from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback # this callback is used for the main report parsing class PyStreamCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self, flowfile, ctx): self.ff = flowfile self.ctx = ctx pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.readLines(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) reports = self.ctx.getProperty("report.types").getValue() for line in text: ip = re.match(r'^"([^"]+)",.+$', line) tags = re.match(r'^"[^"]+",(.+)$', line) tags = re.sub(r'"', "", tags.group(1)) outputStream.write('"' + ip.group(1) + '","' + tags + "\"\n") ##content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\']', "\\'", content) # escape out all single quotes #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\"]{2}', '\\"', content) # Hive escape out all SQL escaped quotes #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[\\][\"]([\n\r])+', '
', content) # escape out all escaped quotes #content = re.sub(r'(?m)[^\"]([\n\r]+)', '
', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks #content = re.sub(r'(?m)([\\][^\"\\]*)', r'\\\1', content) # replaces embedded newlines in strings to html breaks #outputStream.write(line + "\n") # main starting point - gets the flowfile and proceeds to read and parse flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile,PyStreamCallback(flowFile, context)) #flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", flowFile.getAttribute('filename').split('.')[0]) #flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'report', "HEADER") session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)
